dmca.title: Searching For Names Yields Infringing Photographs?
dmca.body:
Google, inc.
Attn: [Private]
[Private]
[Private], CA [Private]
fax to: [Private]

Angigass.com - [Private]
[Private]
[Private], OR. [Private]
[Private]@efn.org
[Private]

Attn: [Private]:

I would like to file a notice of infringement. When I do an Image search for the name "[Private]' on Google, an image comes up that was taken from my photography website. It is being used and hosted by someone else. This image is copyrighted and I have never granted any use of the image to anyone.
Here is a link to the website- webzine.soundart.co.kr/contents/s_list.jsp?cp...
Here is the offending photo [inline photo]
Here is where they have it stored on their server (I think), webzine.soundart.co.kr/contents/adm/f_ list/9.jpg

I have emailed them several times asking for removal but they have not replied. Here is the email address listed for their webmaster- [Private]@soundart.co.kr

I have a good faith belief that use of the copyrighted materials described above on the allegedly infringing web pages is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law.

I swear, under penalty of perjury, that the information in the notification is accurate and that I am the copyright owner or am authorized to act on behalf of the owner of an exclusive right that Is allegedly infringed.

Thank you!
